metadata.Title: CVE-2023-25139 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description: sprintf in the GNU C Library (glibc) 2.37 has a buffer overflow(out-of-bounds write) in some situations with a correct buffer size. Thisis unrelated to CWE-676. It may write beyond the bounds of the destinationbuffer when attempting to write a padded, thousands-separated stringrepresentation of a number, if the buffer is allocated the exact sizerequired to represent that number as a string. For example, 1,234,567 (withpadding to 13) overflows by two bytes.

criterions.comment: glibc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
